title: Could not connect to HTTP server.
body: My League of Legends Client has recently not been working when I open it;  **Could not connect to HTTP server. Please check that your Internet connection is enabled and that your firewall is not blocking access.**

replies.body:
this helped me, was posted on the Announcements page under log on issues:

Guys this worked for me:

Go to the right of your task bar and find your Internet connection icon, right click and go to Network Sharing Centre.
Find the "adapter settings". For Windows 8 it's on the panel on the left, not sure for 7 or Mac.
Find your current connection, right click on it, go to Properties
Find "Internet Protocol Version 4", and go into its Properties.
In the DNS Section, instead of automatic, check "Use the following DNS server addresses"
Prefered DNS server: 8.8.8.8
Alternate DNS server: 8.8.4.4
Click OK, exit the settings and try launching LoL again.

try it out, was having the exact same problem and this fixed it.
i tried this but nothing changed.. i even tried restarting my computer afterwards too.
He failed to mention that you must also flush your DNS. Go into your Command Prompt with admin privileges, type in "ipconfig /flushdns" and hit enter.

Ok, I'll get back to this soon.

In the meantime, try running it as an admin with your UAC turned completely off.
It was already off when I tried them.
Have you tried another internet source? This is just to know whether it's the computer or your internet provider.
